thread.title: Oregon shooting: Mother says shooter chose her son to give 'something' to police (watch)
thread.title_full: Oregon shooting: Mother says shooter chose her son to give 'something' to police (watch) | OregonLive.com

author: Elliot Njus | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Oregon shooting: Mother says shooter chose her son to give 'something' to police (watch)
text:
An 18-year-old man in the Umpqua Community College classroom where a gunman killed nine people on Thursday thought he was about to be shot.
Instead, his mother told CNN , the man was told to hand "something" over to police. The news network later said it was an envelope that felt like it contained a USB flash drive.
The mother, Summer Smith, identified her son as Matthew. CNN agreed not to use her son's last name.
"The shooter asked him to give the police a" — Smith hesitated — "something, and that if he did he would live."
Then, Smith said, he was sent to the back of the classroom.
In a news conference Saturday, Douglas County Sheriff John Hanlin declined to discuss the package reportedly handed over to police.
-- Elliot Njus
